intro: Elattostachys globosa, commonly known as the globular stamen plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive inflorescence, which consists of small, clustered flowers arranged in a globular shape. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and often aromatic foliage. Elattostachys globosa typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring moist, shaded environments. Its unique floral structure makes it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
